00038 // A test function.
00039 void SQLiteDatabase::test()
00040 {
00041 //  Sample usage code follows...
00042         std::string strFileName = "sqlite3.txt";        
00043         SQLiteDatabase db;      
00044         try     {
00045         Verbose::out(1, "*");
00046         Verbose::out(1, "Create/Open database: sqlite3.txt");
00047         db.open(strFileName);
00048         SQLiteRecordset rset(db);
00049 
00050         Verbose::out(1, "create table Test1 (Id int primary key, Name varchar(255))");
00051         db.execute("create table Test1 (Id int primary key, Name varchar(255))");
00052         Verbose::out(2, "create table Test1 (Id int primary key, Name varchar(255))");
00053         db.execute("create table Test2 (Id int primary key, Name varchar(255))");
00054         
00055         Verbose::out(1, "Begin transaction...");
00056         db.beginTransaction();
00057         for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex < 10); iIndex++)
00058         {
00059                 std::string strSQL = "insert into Test1 values (" + ::getInt(iIndex) + ", 'Test1-" + ::getInt(iIndex) + "')";
00060                 Verbose::out(1, "\t" + strSQL);
00061                 db.execute(strSQL);
00062         }
00063         for (int iIndex = 1; (iIndex < 10); iIndex++)
00064         {
00065                 std::string strSQL = "insert into Test2 values (" + ::getInt(iIndex) + ", 'Test2-" + ::getInt(iIndex) + "')";
00066                 Verbose::out(1, "\t" + strSQL);
00067                 db.execute(strSQL);
00068         }
00069         Verbose::out(1, "Commit transaction...");
00070         db.commitTransaction();
00071         
00072         Verbose::out(1, "select Test1.id, Test1.Name, Test2.Name from Test1, Test2 where Test1.Id = Test2.id");
00073         rset.open("select Test1.id, Test1.Name, Test2.Name from Test1, Test2 where Test1.Id = Test2.id");
00074         while (rset.fetch())
00075         {
00076                 int iID = rset.getInteger(0);
00077                 std::string strName = rset.getString(1);
00078                 std::string strName2 = rset.getString(2);
00079                 Verbose::out(1, "\tfetched: " + ::getInt(iID) + ", " + strName + ", " + strName2);
00080         }
00081         rset.close();   
00082         
00083         Verbose::out(1, "drop table Test1");
00084         db.execute("drop table Test1");
00085         Verbose::out(1, "drop table Test2");
00086         db.execute("drop table Test2");
00087         
00088         Verbose::out(1, "Closing SQLite database");
00089         db.close();
00090         Verbose::out(1, "*");
00091         } catch (SQLiteException& e) {db.rollbackTransaction(); db.close(); Verbose::out(1, e.getMessage());} 
00092 //  End sample usage code
00093 }

00098 SQLiteDatabase::SQLiteDatabase()
00099 {
00100         m_pdb = NULL;
00101         m_pstmt = NULL;
00102         m_bOpen = false;
00103 }

00109 SQLiteDatabase::~SQLiteDatabase()
00110 {
00111         close();

00120 void SQLiteDatabase::error(int iReturnCode, const std::string& strMessage) 
00121 { 
00122         std::stringstream ss;
00123         std::string str;
00124         ss << iReturnCode;
00125         ss >> str;
00126         std::string strMsg = "ERROR: SQLiteCode: " + str + ", Message: " + strMessage;
00127         throw SQLiteException(strMsg);
00128 
00129 }

00136 void SQLiteDatabase::open(const std::string& strFileName, bool bReadOnly)
00137 {
00138         /*
00139         int iFlags = SQLITE_OPEN_READWRITE | SQLITE_OPEN_CREATE;
00140         if (bReadOnly) {iFlags = SQLITE_OPEN_READONLY;}
00141         int iReturnCode = sqlite3_open_v2(strFileName.c_str(), &m_pdb, iFlags, NULL);
00142         if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {error(iReturnCode, "Failed to open SQLite file:\t" + strFileName);}
00143         */
00144         int iReturnCode = sqlite3_open(strFileName.c_str(), &m_pdb);
00145         if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {error(iReturnCode, "Failed to open SQLite file:\t" + strFileName);}
00146         m_bOpen = true;
00147 }
00148 
00152 void SQLiteDatabase::close()
00153 {
00154         if (m_bOpen)
00155         {
00156                 int iReturnCode = sqlite3_close(m_pdb);
00157                 if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {error(iReturnCode, "Failed to close SQLite file.");}
00158                 m_bOpen = false;
00159         }
00160 }
00161 
00167 void SQLiteDatabase::execute(const std::string& strSQL, bool bError)
00168 {
00169         if (m_pdb == NULL) {throw SQLiteException("ERROR: SQLite Database has not been opened."); }
00170         char* pszMsg = NULL;
00171         int iReturnCode = sqlite3_exec(m_pdb, strSQL.c_str(), NULL, NULL, &pszMsg);
00172         if (bError)
00173         {
00174                 if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {std::string str = pszMsg; sqlite3_free(pszMsg); error(iReturnCode, str);}
00175         }
00176         else
00177         {
00178                 if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {sqlite3_free(pszMsg);}
00179         }
00180 }

00186 SQLiteRecordset::SQLiteRecordset(SQLiteDatabase& db)
00187 {
00188         m_pdb = &db;
00189         m_bFirstRow = false;
00190         m_bEOF = true;
00191         m_bOpen = false;
00192 }
00193 
00198 SQLiteRecordset::~SQLiteRecordset()
00199 {
00200         close();
00201 }
00202 
00207 void SQLiteRecordset::open(const std::string& strSQL)
00208 {
00209         const char* pszTail = NULL;
00210         int iReturnCode = sqlite3_prepare_v2(&(m_pdb->getConnection()), strSQL.c_str(), (int)strSQL.length(), &m_pstmt, &pszTail);
00211         if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {m_pdb->error(iReturnCode, "Failed to prepare SQL statement.");}
00212         m_bOpen = true;
00213         m_bFirstRow = true;
00214         m_bEOF = false;
00215 }
00216 
00220 void SQLiteRecordset::close()
00221 {
00222         if (m_bOpen)
00223         {
00224                 int iReturnCode = sqlite3_finalize(m_pstmt);
00225                 if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_OK) {m_pdb->error(iReturnCode, "Failed to finalize SQL statement.");}
00226                 m_bOpen = false;
00227                 m_bFirstRow = false;
00228         }
00229 }
00230 
00235 bool SQLiteRecordset::fetch() 
00236 {
00237         int iReturnCode = sqlite3_step(m_pstmt);  
00238         if (iReturnCode != SQLITE_ROW) {m_bEOF = true;} 
00239         return !m_bEOF;
00240 }
00241 
00247 std::string SQLiteRecordset::getString(int iColumnIndex) 
00248 {       
00249         AffxString str;
00250         char* p = (char*)sqlite3_column_text(m_pstmt, iColumnIndex);
00251         if (p != NULL) {str = p;}
00252         return str;
00253 }
00254 
00260 int SQLiteRecordset::getInteger(int iColumnIndex) 
00261 {
00262         return sqlite3_column_int(m_pstmt, iColumnIndex);
00263 } 
00264 
00270 double SQLiteRecordset::getDouble(int iColumnIndex) 
00271 {
00272         return sqlite3_column_double(m_pstmt, iColumnIndex);
00273 }
